Hi,

I am testing through JUnit a small application, that also accesses a 
database using jdbc.
I have several machines with different types of database, so created the 
following code to register the jdbc driver.

    private DbAccessDriverList() {
        drivers = new ArrayList<Driver>();
        for(String[] s : strDrivers)
            drivers.add(new Driver(s[0], s[1], s[2], s[3], s[4]));
       
        for(Driver dr : drivers) {
            dr.result = register(dr.dbmsName, dr.driverName);
        }
    }
   
    private boolean register(String dbmsName, String driverName) {
        boolean result = false;
        try {
            Class.forName(driverName);
            log.println("Successful registration of \""+dbmsName+"\" 
jdbc driver");
            result = true;
        } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
            log.err("Unable to register \""+dbmsName+"\" jdbc driver, 
ClassNotFoundException for " +
                    e.getMessage());
            result = false;
        }
        log.println("driver for \""+dbmsName+"\" search ended.");
        return result;
    }

Now, what should happen, is that if a jdbc-driver is missing, the 
classnotfound exception is caught, a log error is printed and the 
process continues running none the less.
